docs.lead_paragraph: DETROIT, Feb. 6 Michigan's Attorney General, Frank J. Kelley, ruled today that Gov. George Romney had overstepped his powers by ordering cuts in Medicaid.

headline.main: ROMNEY BLOCKED ON MEDICAID CUTS; Attorney General Rules He Exceeded State Powers

docs.abstract: Mich Atty Gen Kelley rules Gov Romney Dec Exec order cutting back some Medicaid benefits violates const rights of Legis; says he should have asked Legis to act; Soc Services Dir Houston says cuts will remain in force until Atty Gen ruling is clarified; UAW urges Medicaid be implemented fully
docs.snippet: DETROIT, Feb. 6 Michigan's Attorney General, Frank J. Kelley, ruled today that Gov. George Romney had overstepped his powers by ordering cuts in Medicaid.

byline.original: By PAUL HOFMAN Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5-- Within the next few weeks you will probably be facing a set of common cold germs that has not been around since November.

headline.main: U.S. Facing a New Bout With Cold Viruses; Scientists Hunt for Clues to 3 Annual Infection Waves Germs' Complexity Poses Main Puzzle in Seeking Cures U.S. Facing New Bout With Puzzling and Prolific Cold Viruses

docs.abstract: Widespread research on various cold-causing viruses that vanish and reappear in annual cycles discussed; illus; Dr Kapikian of Natl Inst of Allergy and Infectious Diseases int
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 5-- Within the next few weeks you will probably be facing a set of common cold germs that has not been around since November.

byline.original: By HAROLD M. SCHMECK Jr. Special to The New York Times
